devfestahm22-announced.brief: It is official. GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2022 is going to take place in Ahmedabad, 17th December 2022.
devfestahm22-announced.content:
Mark your dates for the biggest developer conclave of the city as **DevFest Ahmedabad 2022** is here on 17th December, 2022.
[Google Developers Group Ahmedabad (GDG Ahmedabad)](http://www.gdgahmedabad.com/) is for the developers, interested in Google's developer technology from Android to App Engine, Google Chrome platforms to product APIs like the Maps, YouTube, Flutter and Tensorflow, all that Google you can think of. GDG Ahmedabad is back with its annual gathering of technology enthusiasts working on Android, Web and Cloud technologies for a day full of sessions, workshops, showcases, networking with other like-minded industry colleagues and ample fun. This year, we expect over **450+ engineers, managers, and entrepreneurs** come to DevFest to learn about Android, Web and Cloud technologies, and to experience the phenomenal atmosphere.

Come and join us at [#DevFestAhm](https://twitter.com/search?q=DevFestAhm) 2022 to witness the best of tech, explore and learn about Flutter, Kotlin, Machine Learning, Tensorflow, Google Cloud, Blockchain, Firebase, AngularJS, ARCore, Actions on Google etc. and experience the magnificent atmosphere with tech all around you.
Tickets - Declare soon

## Stay in Touch!
We would love to see you at #DevFestAhm 2022. **Subscribe to DevFest newsletter** or follow us on [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/GDGAhmedabad/), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GDGAhmedabad/) not to miss any of our announcements and conference updates. We can't wait to meet you in Ahmedabad, the rising tech capital of Gujarat.
- The GDG DevFest Ahmedabad Team.
devfestahm22-announced.title: Announcing GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2022

c4p.brief: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad was announced, for the ninth year in a row, the conference will bring together 450+ developers, managers and...
c4p.content:
**PLEASE READ THE GIVEN INSTRUCTIONS with Focus and Attention**

We are back to rock our 9th DevFest season. Yeah! you have heard it right, we hosted our very 1st DevFest event back in 2013. Before going ahead, we want you to check out the last offline DevFest Ahmedabad event, which would help you in realising the level of quality, knowledge and impact that we are expecting from each speaker.



GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2022 has been announced! The 9th edition of the biggest conference about Google technologies in Ahmedabad will take place on **17th December 2022** in the Heritage city of India.

That means that it is time to open the Call For Speaker form. If you are passionate about your work and want to share your experience with the biggest tech audience in Ahmedabad, you knock on the right door.

Last year DevFest broke all expectations of the audience, speakers, and even our ones. With 92% of satisfied attendees, we can claim that GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2019 was a great success.

To keep up this year, we decided to focus on the content. We’re looking for speakers like you, who are ready to rock the stage and deliver the best talk or workshop in the field.

## Target Audience

The majority of our target audience will be IT professionals (Web/Mobile/Backend Developers / Designers / ML Engineers / Data Scientists / Entrepreneurs and Startup ecosystem enablers, etc.) from 0 to 20 years of experience. We would also welcome students and freshers, only if they have hands-on knowledge on technologies!

## Session Format

- Session - 30 to 45 mins talk, detailed talk on any of the topics mentioned below.
- Lightening
- 10 to 15 mins talk, quick overview on any of the topics mentioned below.
- Keynote - 30 to 45 mins talk

## Session Topics

We will accept talks for our planned tracks such as,

**Web / AI ML / Cloud**

- Web Development, topics not limited to
- Angular
- Firebase
- PWA
- Chrome Developer Tools
- Performance
- Accessibility
- TensorFlow JS
- JavaScript
- Modern Web App Capabilities
- UI / UX Trends
- Blockchain
- NFT
- Web3 development etc.
- AI ML, topics not limited to
- TensorFlow
- Vertex AI
- AutoML
- Dataflow
- Firebase
- ML Kit
- Cloud Natural Language etc.
- Cloud, topics not limited to
- Google Kubernetes Engine
- Compute Engine
- Cloud Storage
- Big Query
- Cloud Functions etc.

**Android / Flutter Development**

- Android/Flutter Development, topics not limited to:
- Flutter/Android scalable architecture best practices
- Kotlin Multiplatform and Flutter, Code for one and generate for multiple platforms
- Optimize your apps for Android Go edition
- Generating apps in no time using No-code or Pro-code platforms
- Adaptive layout and latest UI/UX design trends in Android and Flutter
- Start-up & Emerging Technologies
- Start-up and Emerging Technologies, topics not limited to:
- Preparing pitch deck for tech startups
- Raising funds for the technical products and tech startups
- Products demo showcasing technology implementation and how you have solved real-world problems and developed solutions
- Emerging Technologies like EV Charging, Blockchain, etc.
- Why Startups Fail
- Key Insights on building a startup

**MOST IMPORTANT Expectation from CFPs this year**

This year we are looking for the values and experienced based Talk proposals, wherein you have implemented some practices in your product(s) and you have achieved some users growth, revenue growth, code scalability achieved, generated funding, build MVP with solid principles and practices, etc.

This year we are not expecting talks on topics like Getting started with something or beginner level which one can do search over web and find out easily, like “Getting started with flutter development”, “How to implement in MVVM in Android”, “Getting started with JavaScript technologies”, etc.

**DOs of CFP**

- Please elaborate the topic in a proper way to help understand and review your talk.
- Please submit details about your past talk(s).
- Please include links of your past talk(s) presentations, videos etc.
- Please mention key takeaways of your talks and how it will benefit the developers.

**DON'T of CFP**

- Pitching and marketing of the product or company. Speaker can mention the company name but the focus of the talk should be technology.
- The talk should be the original idea of the speaker and should not be copied over from someone.
- The topic should be relevant for the audience and should not be in the practice in recent years.
- Avoid talks like getting started or hello world.

## Why is it cool to be a speaker?

Well, do you know a better way to attend the conference? Here are our top 3 reasons to submit a proposal.

1️⃣ It is good for your career. By being a speaker, you are proving your level of expertise to potential business partners or employers.
2️⃣ It is good for the company you’re working for. Any presentation delivered by an employee adds credibility to a company’s public image.
3️⃣ Unique networking. Being a speaker means you’ll have a unique chance to network with other speakers - the best experts in the industry.

## Perks of being speaker at DevFestAhm

- Full day access to the conference
- Chance of networking with 500+ developers in the conference

- Exposure to community members on official GDG Ahmedabad social media accounts

- Help from GDG Ahmedabad team members in talk preparation.

**Call for Speakers will stay open until November 30, 2012. Don’t miss out :)**

**Please note:** There is no guarantee that a submission will be put onto the conference agenda! The program committee picks the most interesting talk proposals and informs the selected submitters max by 7th December, 2022.

Any questions? Email any organisers at [pareshmayani@gmail.com](mailto:pareshmayani@gmail.com) OR [dhuma1981@gmail.com](dhuma1981@gmail.com) OR [hdave10@gmail.com](hdave10@gmail.com).

Submit a proposal
c4p.title: We're looking for speakers

101.description: Keynote on everything futuristic in Tech this is going to be a hell of a ride with exciting things coming our way in Tech
101.title: Focus on Future Keynote

102.description:
This talk emphasises on the thought process one can employ to build a design system , with Jetpack Compose - which gets even easier now. 
This talk would introduce Andromeda - an open-source design system with custom components and a customisable theme. We would focus on how to setup a custom theme with custom colors typography and everything else needed to build a custom design system.
102.title: Andromeda - Custom design systems with Compose

103.description:
JavaScript objects are complex; in this live coding-based talk, we will try to simplify that. 
JavaScript is an object-oriented language or not? The answer to this question lies in the understanding of the following concepts, 
-Different ways of JavaScript object creation 
-prototypes and prototype chain 
-this 
__proto__ 

This session will simplify these truly vital topics of JavaScript language. This talk combines live coding and visualization of concepts on the whiteboard.
103.title: You do not know JavaScript Object

104.description:
I am not a CEO of a billion dollar company, well then why should you listen to my experience? From all the people who are present here and who will start their own business, less than 0.01% will make a billion dollar company, rest most folks here would be either making a small to medium scale company, so these are my experiences , my mistakes and my learnings from it, which i would like to share with you all today, from a gujju boy from your neighbouring city Gandhinagar, raised in a middle class family who started his business at the age of 24. 
Interactive session with lot of memes - Things to keep in mind before starting an IT company or startup. Sharing my 2 cents , which new or budding entrepreneurs need to keep in mind before starting new business and / or dropping the good pay job.
104.title: Things I wish someone had told me when i started my IT business

106.description:
To meet the developer demands to make the subscriptions less complex, the Android team at Google has released an entirely new subscription model in May 2022. Are you still trying to wrap your head around the new model? You have come to the right place. 
In this talk you will learn: 
1. What are subscriptions in android? How do they work? 
2. The new structure of in-app subscriptions- What is a base plan, an offer, pricing phases, etc. 
3. How to construct your app’s in-app subscriptions according to the new billing library structure? 
4. How to query data from the APIs like queryProductDetailsAsync and queryPurchasesAsync? 
5. Examples on how to structure subscriptions for your apps. 
By the end of the talk, you will be able to construct your app for monetization with a clear understanding of what would be your base plans, various offers for each plan, and the pricing phases in which you would like to roll out your in-app products.
106.title: Deep Dive into the new Google Play Billing library v5.0

107.description: Identity and access management (generally referred to as IAM) is the practice of granting the right individuals access to the right resources for the right reasons. This talk will discuss the general practice for IAM including corporate identities, customer identities, service identities, granting access to google services, applications and resources. The participants will be able to understand the provisioning and managing identities users and groups. In addition, will also be able to understand enabling secure authentication to services and workloads.
107.title: Managing Identities and secure access with GCP Security

108.description: In this talk, we’ll take a deep dive into web animations. Firstly, We will look at the history of web animation starting from SMIL, its evolution and transformations, the different types of animations available today CSS, JS or CSS + JS + Third party libraries, how to choose a suitable type for your requirements, while keeping it performant. Of course, we’ll close it with a brief walkthrough of the new good stuff such as Page Transitions coming in the Web Animations API.
108.title: Web Animations : Past, Present & Future

109.description:
In the season of mass layoffs going off, it's supercritical for engineers to understand what goes into building self-propelling growth products with profits. Products which have business models which will not reap benefits after making huge losses for years but the ones which will earn you hard bucks from day 1. 

This session will focus on 
-What are business models and what suits your business best? 
-How to engineer the pricing model? 
-How to grow revenue? 
How to run successful experiments? 

Why it is supercritical? 
It's Supercritical for building your own next profitable unicorn or assessing whether you are part of a company which has a profitable future (unlike the FTX saga)
109.title: How to build Profitable Business ? - The 0-1 and 1-10 Journey

110.description:
Here we will cover different static lint checks for code analysis for the Kotlin Jetpack Compose. That will helps any developer team size to validate the code quality before having the code review. On another side, Sonarqube help to identify the code quality in depth. That will identify the Code smells, Duplication, vulnerabilities, Major issues, Blocker issues, security Issues, and more. Ultimately the goal of the developer should be to make a flag PASS on SonarQube. That indicates your code is aligned with best practices and easy to adopt by any other team members. 

Approach: 
1. What is code review and Why it is required? 
2. Code Review Terminologies 
3. Static Code Analysis in Jetpack Compose 👨‍💻 
4. SonarQube Code Review automation for Android and Flutter 👨‍💻 
5. Summary & Conclusion 
6. Q&A
110.title: Make your code shine with Static Analysis and SonarQube

111.description:
With ML becoming more mainstream, the need for reinventing the wheel has decreased & there is very little entry barrier for creating ML powered applications. TensorFlow Hub is an open repository and library for reusable machine learning. The tfhub.dev repository provides many pre-trained models: text embeddings, image classification models, TF.js/TFLite models and much more. 

The repository is open to community contributors. Gradio is the fastest way to demo your machine learning model with a friendly web interface so that anyone can use it, anywhere! In this session, I'll demonstrate how one can use TensorFlow Hub & Gradio to create a fully functional ML powered web application.
111.title: Building ML Powered Web Applications using TensorFlow Hub & Gradio

112.description:
LHello world to Computer Vision - most tutorials on the internet don't take you beyond the basic implementations. 

In this talk, I will take you through a story of how we built a scalable distributed computer vision platform which helped a startup raise $600,000 of funding. This solution was implemented at National University of Singapore. 

Outline: 
Introduction to the speaker and topic 
Problem statement description 
How it started 
The roadblocks we hit 
How we overcame those roadblocks 
Towards fundraising 
Q/A
112.title: Scaling Computer Vision: From tutorials to fundraising

113.description:
Government of Gujarat’s persistent efforts towards creating an innovation/startup-centric ecosystem in the state. Gujarat was awarded best performer for the third time in a row in the “State Startup Ranking” by the Ministry of Commerce, Government of India. 

Gujarat has been at the forefront of working towards the Hon’ble Prime Minister’s ‘Startup India’ mission. To provide a thriving environment to empower and encourage its young innovators and entrepreneurs, the Education Department, Government of Gujarat, has formulated and successfully implemented its iconic Student Startup and Innovation Policy (SSIP). Gujarat Student Startup and Innovation Hub (i-Hub), registered under Section 8 of the Companies Act 2013 (Not for profit organization), is envisioned to be a center for all Startup stakeholders to develop an end-to-end innovation and entrepreneurial ecosystem in the State by creating pathways from “Mind-to-Market.” i-Hub is a vibrant incubation setup established under SSIP by the Education Department, Government of Gujarat.
113.title: Startup Ecosystem - Gujarat

114.description: Blockchain technology and the crypto space in general are one of the major trends in the world right now. The number of increasing buzzwords such as NFTs, ETFs, DApps, and DeFi are undeniable markers to this assertion. In this session you will understand how we can jump into the web3 space on mobile. We will learn what all you need to create a dApp using Flutter.
114.title: Flutter in the Web3 space

115.description:
We will be sharing our experiences including, 
Education obtained in and outside of the University 
Live Projects and Internships 
Networking and Community 
Interview Experiences 
Professional Journey 
Mistakes we have made
115.title: The way we've carved out our path in Data Science

116.description:
How to do Micro Front end with Module federation 
Micro FrontEnd with Module federation 

1) Why we need Micro Front End 
2) What is module federation 
3) Webpack 5 Module Federation 
4) Why webpack module federation 
5) Demo with Angular 
6) Challenges of Module federation and Micro front ned 
7) Resources
116.title: Micro FrontEnd with Module federation

117.description:
As engineers, we know how to build a product end to end. However, it can be a big step for us to wear an entrepreneur hat and also sell the product. Over the past few years, we have engineered three mobile app startups and have raised funds for two of them. 

In the session, we will be sharing our knowledge about creating a pitch deck, getting initial traction and reaching out to investors to successfully raise funds.
117.title: Build your own startup as an engineer entreprenuer.

119.description: You all must've heard that everything in Flutter is widget, while it's not the fact, When we are building Flutter apps, we mostly interact with outer layer of the Widgets. In this talk we will go deep down into the Widget and will learn about Widget rendering, inspector and life cycle.
119.title: Understanding Widgets in Flutter

120.description:
One of the advantages of using Cloud and its ecosystem, is that we don't need to reinvent the wheel e.g. database, message queue,AI/ML etc. For any API need, it is just a click away. 

Google Cloud provides a rich set of API services e.g. Translation, Pub/Sub, Analytics etc., which can cater most of the distributed application integration needs with less or no effort. 

As part of this session we will build a microservice from scratch that will leverage Google APIs. As part of the development process we will also explore how to increase our application delivery velocity i.e. deploying application quicker/faster into production by automating the build and test using an open source project Drone – a Self-service Continuous Integration platform for busy development teams
120.title: How to Build Applications using Google API

121.description: It's been 15 years since I've been exploring the horizon of IT, Software development and Startup ecosystem. During this tenure, I've worked with multiple startups and I've helped many clients in developing a great set of products, which helped them in generating revenue and scaling up their business. During this talk, I will be sharing key insights on building a startup, things I wish I knew before I started my own venture. Insights and experience like how to build MVP version, which top 3 selling features should go into the MVP Version and how to decide top selling features, how to build a great team, how to build portfolio and winning clients, how to remove redundant tasks and implement automation to reduce efforts and increase productivity. Hope to see you folks at GDG Ahmedabad DevFest 2022!
121.title: Key Insights on Building a Startup

122.description: Devtools are driving the tech revolution: Get ahead of the game by exploring the rapidly-expanding devtool market and discover the latest trends and opportunities for startups.
122.title: The future of devtools: Trends and opportunities for startups

132.description: Get your badge, coffee, enjoy talking with tech edicts around
132.title: Registration & morning Coffee

136.description: Official start of the conference. Greetings from the Paresh Mayani and Jaldeep Asodariya
136.title: GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2022 Opening

137.description: Afterparty is a great time to have some fun and meet new people
137.title: Afterparty & Networking

138.description: Make sure you won't miss closing ceremony, all gifts from out sponsors and partners will find their owners during this session.
138.title: Conference closing and contest winners announcements

141.description: Networking and Separation Break for different tracks
141.title: Networking - Separation Break

dhananjay_kumar.bio:
Dhananjay Kumar is a teacher, published author, and creator of one of the world's largest Angular/JavaScript communities ng-India. Dhananjay Kumar is a consultant and well-known trainer with around 750 Hrs of experience of teaching Angular and overall approximately 2000 Hrs to students from various backgrounds. 

Dhananjay's clientele includes but not limited to Aristocrat, NRI, Bethel, Times Now, Accenture, Acheron, AIS, and Kovai.co, etc. 

Dhananjay is a prolific tech writer with around 1000 articles in his credit, exemplary speaker with about 75 talks, and author of the best-selling book, Angular Essentials. For his contributions to the developer community, he is awarded Microsoft Most Valuable Professional Award 10 times and recognized as a Developer Expert in Angular by Google. 

Dhananjay is also the founder of geek97, which enables developers to be job-ready, and organizes India’s Largest Angular Conference, ng-India. 

Dhananjay is known for his unique way of teaching, in which he solely relies on writing code with visualization to explain a certain topic. As of now he is teaching and doing consulting on JavaScript, Angular Azure, NodeJS, dotnetcore , microservices #tdd, etc.
dhananjay_kumar.name: Dhananjay Kumar
dhananjay_kumar.shortBio: Dhananjay Kumar is a teacher, published author, and creator of one of the...
dhananjay_kumar.title: Angular Educator and founder of ng-India

kamesh_sampath.bio:
An Author, Consultant and Developer Advocate; Kamesh is a Director of Developer Advocacy at https://harness.io. Kamesh is also Google Developer Expert for Google Cloud (Kubernetes). As part of his role he actively educates developers on Kubernetes/OpenShift, Cloud Native CI/CD, Servicemesh, and Serverless technologies. With a career spanning close to two decades, with the services industry he has helped various enterprise customers build Java-based solutions. Kamesh has been an active Open Source contributor for more than decade. 

As part of his developer philosophy he strongly believes in LEARN MORE, DO MORE and SHARE MORE!

Anubhav has been a contributor to several open-source projects and was a Google Summer of Code participant in 2019. He also leads the team at GDG Cloud Kolkata. You will often find him talking about System architecture, Machine Learning and the web.

kuntal_shah.bio:
Kuntal is a co-founder of CricHeroes. 

CricHeroes is an India-first Mobile-first platform organizing the vast sector of Indian Local Cricket. It bridges the gap between passionate amateur cricketers and international cricketers with the help of technology. It provides a platform for millions of local cricketers to showcase their talent and get recognition for their achievements. 

Apart from CricHeroes, Kuntal has an active interest in learning Patanjali Yoga and other Vedic Literature.

It is a community driven platform where technogy and gamified cycling experience is at core. The app users earns free gifts and deep discounts by redeeming crooze coins. She is passionate about revolutionizing how people move around by using technology and behavioral economics.

manoranjan_padhy.bio: Manoranjan works on the Developer Communities Program in India along with managing the India specific social handle of Google Developers. Before working for Google, Manoranjan used to contribute closely to developer communities and other educational institutions in the western part of India in the process of growth and knowledge sharing. He is passionate about Machine Learning and assisting people build things using it. On the personal side Manoranjan loves travelling to different places and meeting people.

paresh_mayani.bio: Paresh Mayani is a full time mobile application developer having 7 years of experience in app development. He has been working on android application development since Cupcake(Android 1.5). Over the span of period, he has worked on many challenging mobile projects in different domains like Automobile, e-commerce and health care. He is an avid Open source enthusiast, who has been organizing events as well as blogging, speaking and mentoring on Android related topics since 2010. He can be frequently found giving talks on various topics ranging from android development best practices, android UI/UX, android testing and Android BLE at Domestic & International conferences such as Android Developer Days Turkey (Droidcon Ankara), DevFest Kathmandu, GDG DevCamp and NitroDroid. He has been actively supporting his fellow android developers through various online and offline means. His has published more than 150 articles on his blog TechnoTalkative on which he writes about various technical solutions for Android Development. He holds 80000+ reputation on StackOverflow , where he is also in 10 highest reputation holders for Android tag. He is also been nominated for the Google Developers Expert for Android program. Recently he was invited to attend the Google IO 2016 event at Mountain View, California. Currently he is working as a Technical Lead - Android at Simform Solutions Pvt. Ltd. He is also been a mentor for start-ups having android apps. He is a founder/organizer of Google Developers Group, Ahmedabad , one of the senior most organiser in India. **Previous talks** - DevFest Ahmedabad 2016 - DevFest Pune 2016 and DevFest Baroda 2016 - Android Developer Days 2016, Ankara, Turkey - Android Developer Days 2015, Ankara, Turkey - GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2015 - GDG DevFest Ahmedabad 2014 - GDG DevFest Kathmandu - September 2013 - GDG DevFest Kathmandu - September 2013
paresh_mayani.name: Paresh Mayani

2014.title: Introduction to Android Wear & Wear UI Patterns

2015.title: Engineering Android apps for Performance & Quality

2017.title: Generating Efficient APK by Reducing Size & Improving Performance

paresh_mayani.title: Technical Lead

He likes to contribute to Open Source Projects. He is a huge fan of fancy android libraries where he reports bugs, fixes them and give the valuable feedbacks. He has been a speaker at DrodCon, TiCon and JSFoo previously.

He likes to develop products which impact human life at large scale, are data intensive problems and require out of box thinking. Being in field with the users who are going to use the product he develops gives him an unprecedented feeling of accomplishment.

Hardik has extensively worked on Android and Java since 2010 and also immersed himself in Kotlin. He loves contributing back to the development community by spending time on stack overflow and writing tech blogs. He also mentors college students and professionals and companies who has keen interest in mobile app development. He is active as a GDG community speaker. He recently presented a talk in GDG Pune DevFest-2017. He is a co-author of an upcoming book 'Kotlin Blueprints'.

Hiren has a passion for developing web apps, mobile apps and writing books and blog articles about programming. He has a solid experience of startups as he manages products for few startups. He is also passionate about researching and learning new technologies and trends.

Not only in Android, but also he has experience on various cross platform tools, Back-end and Web technologies. In his free time, he contributes to developer community at Github and Stackoverflow. A good Sniper in CounterStrike ;)

kapil_bakshi.bio:
Kapil Bakshi is a very passionate techie with an aim to embrace technology, imbibe every bit of it, transcend all the barriers and turn ideas into reality. His experience spans across edtech, fintech and logistics sectors where he has developed things from scratch taking them to a level where they have scaled drastically and have become a brand in their respective domains. 

He is currently working at BlackBuck which is redefining the logistics landscape of India, making it reliable and efficient. Kapil is playing an important role there to improve quality of all apps, doing optimisations and helping the company scale to go much beyond. 

Apart from Android, he has worked on Backend technologies as well and many times single-handedly built complex features which have proven to be very beneficial for business. 

In Android, his areas of interest include testing, architectural best practices and security. 

Kapil has also given talks on architectural best practices and testing and has been invited at International Conferences like Droidcon Beijing 2017 .
kapil_bakshi.name: Kapil Bakshi

2017.title: Production Level Test Driven Development and What's new

mehul_patel.bio: Mehul Patel is specialized in Information Technology and Services. He is passionate about what he gets involved in. He holds a Masters in Computers Science and has been working on Linux since 4 years. He is a Developer Tech by profession, An open source enthusiast, Linux geeky and a maker by heart. He believes in the thought saying 'Nothing is more fulfilling than being part of a team with similar interests'.

prajyot_mainkar.bio: Prajyot Mainkar is the director of Androcid - A Mobile engineering development company based out of Goa and one of the winner's of Goa State CM Startup Award. He has been associated with Hon. PM Shri. Narendra Modi's PMO initiative of MYGOV. In mentoring more than 50 startups under the PMO initiative. Recipient of the Young Entrepreneur of the year by Business Goa and one of the 14 Intel innovators in the country, Prajyot has delivered more than 350 talks across the globe of which the prominent have been Droidcon Greece, Android Developer Days in Turkey, Google developer summit, Sri Lanka. Yourstory, one of India's leading startup brand recognized him as the Android man of Goa and was also featured as top techies in India in 2015. He is the technical advisor to India's one of the leading Digital Incubator For Students - The Startup Village and also several other incubators. Recently, became the first Goan author to publish a book on Mobile Technology called - Expert Android Programming, which is circulated in UK, India, Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bangladesh. Post that, published another book on Flutter. He is also on the board of EDC Ignite as an advisor and industry advisor to Goa Stage IT policy.GEMS(Goa entrepreneur mentoring service) recently awarded him The trailblazer excellence award for contribution of IT in Goa.
prajyot_mainkar.name: Prajyot Mainkar

2019.title: Keynote - Don't Build a Startup, Build a Culture

prajyot_mainkar.title: Founder

Being a blogger and open source lover he keen interest in to help developers & students who look forward to growing their careers in the field of Mobile Computing.

Currently heading one of the Engineering divisions responsible for Software Environments/Cloud Architecture with a focus on Automation technologies. He is a Google Developer Expert for Google Cloud Platform and actively manages Google Cloud Developers Community, Mumbai. He speaks at various conferences and mentors Students, Young Professionals as well as local businesses on Cloud Technologies using the Google Cloud Platform and Open Source technologies. Loves travelling, back-packing as well as trekking off to unexplored destinations.

himadri_pandya.bio: Himadri Pandya is pursuing a Masters in Technology in the domain of Information and Communication Technology with a specialization in Machine Intelligence from DAIICT, India. She is currently exploring the field of computer vision. She is fascinated with Operating Systems and has worked with the Linux kernel as an Outreachy intern. During her internship, she has worked on improving the Linux kernel support for running as a guest on Microsoft's hypervisor Hyper-V with larger page sizes on ARM64 architecture. When she is not glued to the computer screen, she reads motivational and philosophical literature, practices Karate and plays her guitar.

anubhav_singh.bio: A Web Developer since before Bootstrap was born, I began my journey in the field of computer science in my 8th grade with my first two projects being - a search engine and a social network right from scratch using LAMP stack. Currently an active Machine Learning explorer, I've used Python for all reasons and seasons over the last 4 years including Data Science to ACM ICPC Regional Finals for 2 consecutive years, where I fell prey to a precision loss in Python - and hence the will to master it. I'm an active speaker at Google Developers Group Kolkata talking often about machine learning and cloud computing, including the GDG DevFest Kolkata 2018. I'm also a speaker for the Elastic Search Kolkata Community and Neo4j Community. I am among the youngest instructors at DataCamp, which is a global platform for learning DataScience. I'm also currently authoring 2 books on Deep Learning using Python expected to be published in late 2019 by Packt Publications. I have been recognized as an Intel Software Innovator.
anubhav_singh.name: Anubhav Singh

He believes in writing quality code and quality matters a lot to him. He’s also a huge fan of React ecosystem and believes that react has made him a better developer. He’s also active in contributing to open source. DX matters a lot to him. The way UX is important for the users, DX is important for developers. It makes development productive. He recently built a node app using GraphQL and Prisma with all the amazing toolings and has also contributed in Prisma’s Github and Slack community.

Also active in contributing to open-source projects and writing useful blog posts. He always likes to explore what's new in the JavaScript community and implement those in his repository. He is also active in the developer communities in Twitter, Slack, Dev.to as well as local meetups. Also, he’s a huge DevOps fanboy, who loves to tinker with AWS services. Also, invited to speak at Inside VOICE podcast by VOICE Summit 2019 Also got selected for the Bixby Premier Developer Program. Being a tech enthusiast, I'm a huge fan of FaaS and JavaScript, passionate about conversational AI. I happen to deliver a talk on Actions on Google at GDG AHMEDABAD'S DevFest last year. Worked as a software developer intern at Winimy, where I design & develop the voice user interface and voice user experiences.Earlier worked on a Research paper on BlockChain based Advanced Public Transport System. nishant_dubey.bio: I consider myself a problem solver, the kind of work I do comprises of intensive user research to find a problem and then designing a user experience to solve it with a unique user interface that evolves as the identity of the brand. The kind of solutions I can design could be for a desktop application, portables or any other medium that can benefit from the user experience I designed. I have deep understanding about the web architecture and consider my self a specialist in portable/mobile design solutions (for android). With an obsession to produce high performance apps that have a unique experience and still work without crashing or launching in most extreme hardware configurations. My association with creativity has been since childhood when I used to click photographs and even won numerous awards for various creative showcases overtime. That interest later developed into a more profound Degree in Visual Effects and Motion graphics from a top film college in United Kingdom. Even then I impressed my lecturers and peers with my creativity and skill-set and went on to win biggest student film and visual effects award of UK sponsored by Cinefex magazine/presented by Oscar Winner vfx supervisor Paul Franklin.

charmi_chokshi.bio: Working with data and predicting future based on it is Charmi's passion and it has always made her feel like a Magician! She is an AI and Data enthusiast who loves to share her experiences with others. She often organises workshops, and talks to help developers & students who look forward to grow their careers in the field of Artificial Intelligence. She has facilitated the first pilot of Google's Machine Learning Crash Course in India back in 2017 and was a Research Trainee at Indian Space Research Organisation in 2018. After completing BTech in ICT Engineering currently, she is building the Next Generation Document Agent to automate the data entry and paperwork involved in global supply chains for Gigabytes of Structured and Unstructured data​ at Shipmnts.com.
